page.title: 01COWLING A MOORLAND VILLAGE 1
page.content: The Parish of{COWLING}is situated near to the boundary between North Yorkshire and Lancashire.Originally made up of three early settlements known as Cowling Hill,Stott Hill and Ickornshaw,it was collectively known, at the time of the{Domesday Book}as {Collinghe.}The entries state"In Collinghe Roger P.2 carucates 2 bovates" "In Collinghe Archil had 2 carucates and 2 bovates". For many years an industrial village based on textiles,over the last twenty years radical changes have taken place as the textile industry has contracted.Many small industries have taken the place of the larger firms which had offered employment previously.Even farming,which had played a very large part in the life of the district,has changed. { }
